definition: clown/2nd earthly branch: 1-3 a.m., 12th solar month (6th January to 3rd February), year of the Ox/ancient Chinese compass point: 30°

sentences.english: He will go to clown school.
Though it looks like the Chicoms are trying hard, especially in Africa.
sentences.chinese: 雖然看起來中國小丑們一直在努力着，尤其是在非洲。

sentences.english: I don't like clowns - they really freak me out.
sentences.chinese: 我不喜歡小丑，他們真的會嚇壞我。

sentences.english: He is only a political buffoon, I have indentified it.
sentences.chinese: 他只是一個政治小丑而已，鑑定完畢。

sentences.english: The performance of the clown kept the public rolling about.
sentences.chinese: 小丑的表演使觀衆笑得前仰後合。

sentences.english: The clown panicked the audience with a gag.
sentences.chinese: 小丑插科打諢逗得觀衆大笑。

sentences.english: Mimes , in the form of God on high.
sentences.chinese: 裝扮成上帝的一羣小丑。

sentences.english: Clownfish hide among the poisonous tentacles of a sea anemone without being hurt.
sentences.chinese: 小丑魚躲茂在海葵有毒的觸鬚中不會受傷。

sentences.english: The cap of a jester was decorated to resemble the comb of a rooster.
sentences.chinese: 小丑的帽子，裝飾得像公雞的雞冠一樣。

sentences.english: When she saw the clowns, her tears gave way to laughter.
sentences.chinese: 當她看到小丑演出時，破涕爲笑。

sentences.english: It is an exaggerated fear of clowns.
sentences.chinese: 這是對小丑一種誇大了的恐懼。

sentences.english: He looks like Bozo the clown.
This service is provided in collaboration with the Theodora Foundation from Switzerland.
sentences.chinese: 小丑醫生服務由瑞士菲奧多拉基金與智樂合作提供。

sentences.english: Clowns like to make people laugh.
That he is a buffoon with bathroom fixtures of gold?
sentences.chinese: 他是個小丑，家裏的衛生間都鍍着金？

sentences.english: The clowns are going to bring up the rear at the parade.
sentences.chinese: 小丑們將在遊行隊伍中殿後。

definition: comical/funny/amusing/old pr. [gu3 ji1]/huaji, a form of comedy performance popular in Shanghai, Jiangsu and Zhejiang
